content.description: A group of birds is found in an island chain that have all descended from a single ancestral species. Figure 1 shows the phylogeny of the birds.
content.question: Figure 1. Phylogeny of island birds Which of the following best explains the divergence in morphology in the birds?

choices.label: The original habitat contained mutagens, leading to the rise of new species as a result of accumulated mutations.
The original habitat had many available unoccupied ecological niches that were colonized by populations of the original species.
The original habitat contained many predators, and the species diversified in order to avoid extinction.
The original habitat was tropical, which increased the rate of mutation and led to rapid diversification.

content.answer: The original habitat had many available unoccupied ecological niches that were colonized by populations of the original species.
